intro: Hoffmannia pauciflora subsp. pauciflora, commonly known as the narrow-leaved hoffmannia, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It is a shrub characterized by its small, narrow leaves and clusters of white or pale yellow flowers. The species belongs to the family Fabaceae, which includes legumes, and is known for its ability to fix nitrogen in the soil. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is adapted to arid or semi-arid environments. The plant is of interest to botanists due to its unique morphology and ecological adaptations.
